definition: to investigate/to examine closely
to examine/to investigate/carefully/to try (in court)
short name for Chahar Province 察哈爾|察哈尔[Cha2 ha1 er3]
to examine/to inquire/to observe/to inspect/to look into/obvious/clearly evident

sentences.english: A Magistrates’ court sits without a jury.
sentences.chinese: 治安法庭審察時沒有陪審團。

sentences.english: His problem will be studied carefully.
Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman pray unto God uncovered?
sentences.chinese: 你們自己審察，女人禱告神，不蒙着頭，是合宜的嗎。

sentences.english: A minister's actions come under minute scrutiny in the press.
sentences.chinese: 一個部長的各種行爲都會受到報界仔細的審察。
他的理論經不起周密的審察。

sentences.english: A cat may look at a king.
sentences.chinese: 貓也可以審察國王，意爲大家劃一。

sentences.english: The auditor began the examination of accounts.
The crisis has forced a reexamination of American nuclear policy.
sentences.chinese: 這場危機敦促美國要重新審察其核政策。

definition: lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
(desired) effect/(expected) result/effective
clan/race
(idiom) to use methods appropriate to the current situation
to obstruct/to impede
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
to nip in the bud (idiom)
just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
almost on a par
to spend the whole day eating (i.e. not doing any work)
to prove/to confirm/to corroborate/convincing proof
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to concentrate on the main points (idiom); to bring out the essentials
mutual relations/common interest
Reiki (palm healing)
to keep on the right side of everyone (idiom)/warm and affable
